natural problem: What is the value of the expression $[ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ]$ when $a = 17$, $b=21$ and $c=5$?
natural solution: We also could have simplified the expression first: \begin{align} [ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ] &= [a-b+c] - [a-b-c]\\ &=a-b+c -a+b+c\\ &=2c. \end{align} Then, we have $2c = 2(5) = 10$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 17"
and h1 : "b = 21"
and h2 : "c = 5"
shows  "(a - (b - c)) - ((a - b) - c) = 10"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the value of the expression $[ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ]$ when $a = 17$, $b=21$ and $c=5$? The final Answer is 10
 ### Proof
 We could evaluate directly: \begin{align} [ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ] &= [17 - (21-5)] - [(17-21)-5]\\ &= [17-16] - [-4-5]\\ &= 1 - (-9) = \boxed{10}. \end{align}
 We also could have simplified the expression first: \begin{align} [ a-(b-c) ] - [(a-b) - c ] &= [a-b+c] - [a-b-c]\\ &=a-b+c -a+b+c\\ &=2c. \end{align} Then, we have $2c = 2(5) = 10$.
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 17"
and h1 : "b = 21"
and h2 : "c = 5"
shows  "(a - (b - c)) - ((a - b) - c) = 10"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Calculate the result of $(17 - (21 - 5)) - ((17 - 21) - 5)$. The final answer is $10$.
